We provide end to end solutions in the fields of accounting, finance and payroll for UK and India based companies. The services that we provide are payroll and accounting outsourcing. For details about Top source, please visit our website: http://www.topsource.in  , http://www.topsource.co.ukJob profileThe role of a Executive India Accounts is to ensure that the tasks assigned are completed on time, accurately and completely. He is responsible for understanding the promised service to his client(s). He is responsible for following all the agreed processes and procedures diligently and without any requirement for follow-up from his line manager. His responsibilities includes attending all training programs assigned to him, attend periodic team meetings, feedback sessions and to seek clarifications where the process or deliverables are unclear to him. He is responsible to ensure that his attendance is regular and his absences are planned. The Executive India Accounts reports into the Team Leader and is required to escalate issues to his direct line manager related to client servicing. There are no roles that report into the Executive India Accounts .The Executive India Accounts should have at least 12 months of experience Some of the key the responsibilities include the following:*Preparation of vouchers, data punching in TALLY*Booking of invoice in AP and raising of invoice in AR.*Preparation of ledger, BRS,MIS reporting, Accruals and prepayments.*Preparation of ledger, TDS,GST,monthly Trial Balance , Profit & Loss Account.*Assisting in Finalization of annual accounts*Preparation of MISCandidate Profile*Must have 1 plus years of experience in Accounts.*BCom/MCom/CA inter/MBA(Finance)*Preference would be given to candidates who have experience in working in outsourcing companies.Personal Characteristics* Should have good written and spoken English.* Motivated, self-starter individual with high level of integrity, intensity and activity with a can-do attitude. * Disciplined process oriented work style* Able to work effectively under pressure* Ability to work equally well either independently or as part of a teamExperience: Min:1 Yrs Max: 5 YrsJob Location : PuneSalary : As per Market standardsContact Person : Pawan Burman Email id :pawan.burman@topsource.co.inRoleAccounts Executive/Accountant,Industry TypeAccounting, Finance,Functional AreaAccounts, Finance, Tax, Company Secretary, Audit,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryAccountsEducationUG :B.Com in CommercePG :M.Com in Commerce, CA in Pursuing , MBA/PGDM in FinanceDoctorate :Doctorate Not RequiredKey Skillslosstdsbrsgsttrial balanceaccountingvoucherstallyprofit

description: Job description  Contract Interior Designer      Nature of Job   : Remote    We are growing our Online Design team! We re looking for experienced interior designers who are entrepreneurially spirited, client-focused and fired up to grow a business in a new and exciting way.     What does a Havenly Online Designer do?      Work online through the Havenly platform to create beautiful designs for clients across the country    Source furnishings and decor from a wide variety of retail, trade and wholesale vendors    Provides remarkable client experiences You receive positive ratings on all designs and are constantly searching for new ways to go above and beyond to meet the needs of your clients    Stays active on social media as well as in local and online communities to bring awareness to their brand and service    Actively follows trends and news in and affecting interior design    Communicate, communicate, communicate Proactively and in a timely fashion communicate with your customers and respond to their inquiries    Offer suggestions Provide both positive and constructive feedback to the Havenly team so we can continually improve the e-Designer experience and help you grow your business      Who are Havenly Online Designers?      Experienced professionals You re experienced in interior design, customer service, and sales   Interior design degree strongly preferred     Photoshop Pros E-Designers are proficient in their use of Photoshop and can create a room rendering from scratch in the system.    Technically savvy You are comfortable with new technologies and navigating online software and systems.    Design Savvy You seek to create interesting and unique, style-forward designs that only an experienced designer could create. You are also familiar with popular US-based retailers and vendors,    Driven You re excited to work independently growing your own business. This is an opportunity that you can run with, and we re here to provide support and resources for all who do    Passionate You are passionate about the interior design industry, your work, and exude that passion in all who come in contact with you      Why you ll love being an Online Designer for Havenly?      The opportunity to run your own business, and build your personal brand, doing what you love.    Get matched with a continuous stream of clients, without spending money on sales and marketing, and without having to ever commute for meetings and appointments.    Achieve flexibility and control over your schedule. Keep your clients happy, while working where you want, when you want.    Be a part of a community of interior designers across the country who share the same interests, passions, skills and experiences.    Have access to, source from, and receive trade discounts from hundreds of retail, trade and wholesale vendors across the country.    Receive ongoing support from the Havenly customer and designer support teams. description: Job description  Job   Description     We are looking for artistic, detail-oriented candidates with good interpersonal skills for the position of Interior Designer. The Interior Designer s key responsibilities include visualizing and sketching design plans as per client goals, sourcing products and materials, determining costs and inspecting construction to ensure alignment with design specifications are met. You will also be expected to comply with the regulatory environment around inspections and building codes.   Good Interior Designers are able to think creatively about the use of space, color and movement and will draw on other artistic mediums for creative inspiration. They will also be effective communicators with the ability to persuade in communicating a design idea.  Interior Designer Responsibilities:    Outline client design objectives.   Conceptualize and sketch design plans.   Determine cost of completion and project requirements in the budgeting phase.   Set a timeline for the completion of an interior design project.   Source materials and products included in plans.   Create mood boards to sample your design vision.   Utilize computer applications in the design process.   Inspect design after completion to determine whether client goals have been met.   Interior Designer Requirements:    Bachelor s degree in Interior Design or related field.   Portfolio of design work.   Project management experience.   Experience with computational design.   Highly creative, imaginative and artistic.   Excellent communication skills, especially in regard to communicating an artistic vision.   Proficiency in AutoCAD, 3DMAX,Illustrator, SketchUp or similar design software. company: HDFC Bank Ltd was promoted in the year 1994 by the premier housing finance company of the country, HDFC Ltd. The Bank commenced operations as a Scheduled Commercial Bank in January 1995. Today the Bank has a nationwide network of over 2000 branches and 5624 ATMs spread over 996 towns and cities across India The Banks American Depository Shares (ADS) are listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) and the Global Depository Receipts (GDRs) are listed on Luxembourg Stock Exchange. The Bank has been bestowed with numerous awards and accolades from top national and international agencies & magazines. HDFC Bank comprises of a dynamic and enthusiastic team determined to accomplish the vision of becoming a World-class Indian bank. Our business philosophy is based on our four core values - Customer Focus, Operational Excellence, Product Leadership and People. We believe that the ultimate identity and success of our bank will reside in the exceptional quality of our people and their extraordinary efforts. We are committed to hiring, developing, motivating and retaining the best people in the industry The Bank’s objective is to build sound business franchises across distinct businesses so as to be a preferred provider of banking services for target retail and wholesale customer segments. We are committed to healthy growth in profitability while ensuring the highest levels of ethical standards, professional integrity, corporate governance and regulatory compliance.
description: Job descriptionResponsible for managing a team size of 15 Personal  Bankers managing prime portfolios Managing team in order to ensure that the portfolio  objectives like cross-sell, income, quality parameters and regular service  interactions etc. are met and the Prime customers are serviced properly. Operations process  adherence should be the main objective with meeting the Audit & Compliance  parameter  Managing the team in order  to ensure proper engagement with customers with focus to increase the digital  penetration and all product penetration to achieve the objective of  income/revenue generation                 Responsible for training and motivating staff.Driving the team for building effective relationship    management with customers and guiding the team for revenue/income generation.      Monitor the revenue generated regularly.   Performance tracking and review with the PB.  Monitor the performance of all the portfolios under    management so as to meet the income targets set month on month.     Driving the team    for achieving the defined    business objective set     Ensure that    every Personal Banker is meeting the defined parameters of the portfolio      Build on the    liability balance s     Every portfolio    to have the required set of groups as per benchmark so as to build    relationship with the customers. Make    the family members part of the program by addition of groups.     Maintain and    track the no of eligible groups in the portfolio.     By engaging with    the customers with cross sell and convenience products      Enhancement of    digital penetration in the portfolios under management with proper NB/MB    activation      Improve the    stickiness of the customer by making the customers use bill pay facility of    the bank.     Penetrate into    other digital products like Bill Pay, Smart-pay/ net-banking/mobile-banking     Contactibility -Ensure the PB    calls the customers as per the calling plan and reaches out to all the    customers at least once in a 4 months     Daily triggers    triggered are contacted timely by the PBs and business opportunities created.     Ensure the    Missed calls and birthday calls are made on time to customers to engage with    the customers.     Check and    monitor the call attempts versus the proper connects and analyses the reason    for non-contactable customers     Supervisory Review-Review the customer transaction history, profile,    interactions, APT and give proper recommendations to the PB for action in CRM    next. Share feedback with the customers post the reviews are done. Check if    the guidance given is being followed by the PBs.     Profilers-Review that the PB updates the information which is sought    with the customers during the conversation made .     Review of    Service interactions updated by the PB whether they are updated in a complete    manner or not      Tracking of    profiler updation of PB on each and every calls and on the basis of the    profiler the PB are interacting with the customers.     Customer    feedback and appreciation is highlighted for improving the PB interactions    with customers      Analyzing the PB    for their problem areas like query handling, objection handling, product    features, pitching etc.     Handling the    calls escalated.     Identify training    gaps and requirement for his team and communicate the same to the UH/    Training Manager     Barging of calls    made by PBs daily followed by giving    feedback and review and check if the feedback has been implemented and there    is improvement.     Motivating the    team and creating the team bonding      Engaging with    team      Control the    attrition in the team and reviewing the reason for it RoleCRM/Phone/Internet Banking Executive,Industry TypeBanking, Financial Services, Broking,Functional AreaFinancial Services, Banking, Investments, Insurance,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryRetail/Personal BankingEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Post Graduation Not Required, Any Postgraduate in Any SpecializationDoctorate :Any Doctorate in Any Specialization, Doctorate Not RequiredKey Skillsrevenue generationCustomer Servicevirtual relationshipPortfolio Managementteam managementtraining managementproduct penetrationcross sellingbankingrelationship managementTelecallingobjection handlingcrm

company: IndusInd Bank Ltd. is a  Customer-focused, technology-based, ISO 9001:2000 certified new generation private sector Bank with ambitious growth plan is looking for the following position.
description: Job descriptionOverall Job Description:Transactions :- Monitor, track and adhere to daily responsibilities, oversee processing of transactions, manage ATMs/Cash/lockers, authorize and verify branch instructions, monitor adherence to processes, resolve escalated issues in order to ensure timely and effective execution of transactions.Operations and Systems Management :- Track market and regulatory changes, monitor, implement changes, ensure systems back-up, align systems with environment changes in order to ensure continuity & adequacy of operations.Responsible for maintenance / reconciliation of Clearing Accounts/NOSTRO Accounts/BCP Accounts - required average daily balance, remitting of excess funds to CO, etc.Customer Service :- Set service standards, ensure resolution of customer grievances, monitor customer services by team, address escalated issues and thereby ensure smooth relationship with clients.People Management Coach, counsel, guide and motivate team members, set targets, monitor performance, define work processes / systems and create a performing team with conducive work environment. Ensure that the Branch meets the BQ score.Branch Administration Ensure proper upkeep of branch premises, Housekeeping, Leave Records, Vendor Management etc. Support Branch Head in sales promotions activities, display of branch merchandise, monitor administration budgets and ensure all branch activities are resourced within targeted financial costs.Generate Customer Leads: Identify customers, call & fix meetings, prepare & make presentations, collect client requirements & other related information e.g. Other banks with which they have business, identify possible products for client, pass the lead to the concerned person & follow up for closing the deal In order to Ensure the Branch Targets & strategies are met. Ensuring the benchmark of FTR % is met.Compliance :- Handle all legal, regulatory, ED, notices end to end and ensure prompt revert to such notices. Ensure all notices are timely logged into Service Desk, Raise Red Flags for all unusual and suspected transactions and ensure no fraudulent transactions take place in the Branch. Responsible for Internal Audit Ratings (Low Risk).Regards,Human Resources - IndusInd Bank.Job Location - Bhuntar,HPRoleOperations Manager,Industry TypeBanking, Financial Services, Broking,Functional AreaFinancial Services, Banking, Investments, Insurance,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryOperations/Processes/Finance/LegalEducationUG :Any GraduatePG :Post Graduation Not RequiredDoctorate :Any Doctorate in Any Specialization, Doctorate Not RequiredKey SkillsBanking Operationscustomer service

description: Job descriptionHi everyone,There is anOpportunity for C04_GRU - Reconciliation - Investment banking-ChennaiJob Description  The Operational Risk Specialist 4 performs relatively  complex assignments. Has direct impact on the business by ensuring the quality  of the tasks or services provided. Works under little to no direct supervision.  May service an expansive and/or diverse array of products/services. Applies  working knowledge of technical and professional principles and concepts and in  depth knowledge of team objectives. Understands how assigned duties contribute  to the work of the team/unit and how the units coordinate their efforts and  resources to achieve the objectives of the function. Ensures the quality and  service of self and others. May recommend new options to enhance productivity  in accordance with guidelines. Requires tact and diplomacy when exchanging  complex or sensitive information with others. Is sensitive to audience  diversity. Basic knowledge of the organization, the business and its policies  required. Typically responsible for resolving basic to moderately complex  problems based on practice and precedence. Able to assess applicability of  similar experiences and evaluate options under circumstances not covered by  procedures.  Responsibilities:    Participates in  the application of operational risk policies, technology and tools, and  governance processes to create lasting solutions for minimizing losses from  failed internal processes, inadequate controls, and emerging risks.   Contributes to  risk assessments and drives actions to address the root causes that  persistently lead to operational risk losses by challenging both historical and  proposed practices.   Provides  governance and oversight may include (not limited to) technology operational  risk, risk for example.   Tracks and  resolves risk issues   Identifies  system or process weaknesses, proposing resolutions that will mitigate the  exposure and increase processing efficiency   Integrates other  control functions to ensure all risks are fully scrutinized   Identifies risks  that cross the businesses and organizing cross-functional solutions   Appropriately  assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular  consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding group, its clients  and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations,  adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal  behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and  reporting control issues with transparency.  Qualifications:   Excellent  written and verbal communication skills Ability to perform under pressure  Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities Ability to function  independently. Proficient in MS Office Word, Excel and PowerPoint applications C- Level - C04 CTC- 4.6 Approximately Shuft - Should be comfortable for any shiftRoleBack Office Executive,Industry TypeBanking, Financial Services, Broking,Functional AreaFinancial Services, Banking, Investments, Insurance,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryTreasuryEducationUG :Graduation Not Required, Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Any Postgraduate in Any Specialization, Post Graduation Not RequiredDoctorate :Doctorate Not Required, Any Doctorate in Any SpecializationKey Skillsstock reconciliationInvestment Bankingposition reconciliationNostro Reconciliationcash reconciliationreconciliation

The Roles and Responsibilities of the Real Estate Consultant would be the following:    Develop trust and relationship with a portfolio of major clients   Acquiring a thorough understanding of key customer needs and requirements  Determining clients needs and financials abilities to propose solutions that suit them  Expanding the relationships with existing customers by continuously proposing solutions that meet their objectives  Resolve any issues and problems faced by customers and deal with complaints to maintain trust  Serve as the link of communication between key customers and internal teams  Strong communication and interpersonal skills with aptitude in building relationships with professionals of all organizational levels  Remain knowledgeable about real estate markets and best practices  Remain enthusiastic and have a fire to perform   ** Complete training and guidance will be given by our expert realtors/VP's on the job front** ** No Targets **  HOW WE ASSIST?   One-on-One interaction with the Vice Presidents on daily basis.  Weekly meeting with the entire team of HRR, pan India.  Caravan - Viewing properties as a team every week.  Monthly Induction session conducted by the Director.  Quarterly Training program(5 days) conducted by In-house experts and Industry Pioneers. Required Candidate profileThe ideal candidate must have the following qualities:1) Strong interpersonal skills and communication2) Excellent negotiation capabilities3) Basic knowledge of MS Office4) Be trustworthy, reliable and a results-driven person5) Passion and fire to learn/succeed6) Candidates from any discipline can apply.7) Age below 37 RoleVP/President/Partner,Industry TypeReal Estate, Property,Functional AreaSelf Employed, Entrepreneur, Independent Consultant,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryOtherEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Any Postgraduate in Any Specialization, Post Graduation Not RequiredDoctorate :Doctorate Not Required, Any Doctorate in Any SpecializationKey SkillsTrainingMajorInductionReal EstateInterpersonal Skills
qualification: ['UG :Any Graduate in Any Specialization', 'PG :Any Postgraduate in Any Specialization, Post Graduation Not Required', 'Doctorate :Doctorate Not Required, Any Doctorate in Any Specialization']
Functional_area: Functional AreaSelf Employed, Entrepreneur, Independent Consultant,

company: Hanu Reddy Realty is a premium Real estate brokerage from South India and Chennai in particular. We have leased more than 4 Million Sft and sold more than Rs 10000 crore of real estate in the past 23 years in India. We have offices in multiple cities in India and our global headquarters is in Irvine, California. Hanu Reddy Realty has been in the Real Estate Industry serving clients' needs for over 30 years. Our principals have deep roots in real estate ownership that span more than 75 years and understand the value of property ownership. With its unique approach towards making realtors an asset to the organization HRR provides training, assistance and proper direction until the time a realtor is fully equipped to take up leads individually.

description: Job description  About Client: Our client is one of the leading Big 4 Consulting Company, offers a full range of consulting services, including financial and business advisory, tax and regulatory, and risk advisory services. In order to further grow their professional services in India, they are looking for talent who specializes in Consultant- Valuation.      Roles and responsibilities:        We are recruiting for an Consultant in the team. Working as an Associate Consultant in this team, your responsibilities will include:   Responsible for the analysis of financials, generating and analysing of research information, preparation of company profiles and proposal supporting documents  Proficiency with relative valuations and market multiples;  Perform company and industry research;  Good working knowledge of Intrinsic valuations (creating and reviewing DCF models);  Developing buy side and sell side pitches, valuation of companies ;  Stay informed of current business, economic and regulatory developments relevant to our clients;and  Establish strong professional relationships with onshore team members    skills required:         Project and Team management exposure:    Credible record of operating as an independent contributor and also working as part of a team during larger projects  High problem solving skills; ability to drive through to an outcome in circumstances of complexity and ambiguity  Goal driven ?? should be focused on helping clients meet their requirements ?? by developing answers and solutions when client requirement remains unclear / changes, and by providing relevant insights and key questions to fit the client objective    Technical skills:    Understanding and exposure to accounting and financial statements analysis;  Proficiency in using research databases like Captial IQ, Merger Market, Bloomberg, Factiva, Thomson Reuters and others.  Good understanding of corporate finance principles, corporate transactions, valuation techniques  Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Power point;  A commercial outlook and a good understanding of the general business and economic environment    Education / professional qualifications:    MBA / CFA  RoleOutside Consultant,Industry TypeStrategy, Management Consulting Firms,Functional AreaSelf Employed, Entrepreneur, Independent Consultant,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryOtherEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Any Postgraduate in Any SpecializationKey SkillsMerger MarketCaptial IQBloombergFactiva

description: Job descriptionJob Description : - Responsible to take care of day to day CAM design activities and able to understand the PCB and customer related process. - Candidate will be working with our senior design team and able to improve the process and solve design related issues. - Following skills are essentials to apply for this position. - Good drawing skills. - Good analytical skills. - Should be a self learner and team player. - Good academic records. - Design, manufacture and testing of control transformers, vibrating coils, chokes and solenoid coils - Design and manufacture of electrical control panels - Perform Peer Reviews of team design work. - Provide technical support for trouble shooting - Inspect, maintain repair and overhaul electromagnetically and solid state electrical equipment, using a variety of electrical test equipment, meters, powered and non-powered tools and equipment. - Perform Overall Maintenance activities in the Plant including Reduce breakdown, Breakdown analysis, doing planned and preventive maintenance QUALIFICATION : BE/DIP EEE EXPERIENCE : 0-3 YEARS SOFTWARE : AUTOCAD/ELECTRICAL CAD RoleDesign Engineer,Industry TypeConstruction, Engineering, Cement, Metals,Functional AreaEngineering Design, R&D,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryEngineering DesignEducationUG :B.Tech/B.E. in Electrical, Diploma in ElectricalPG :Any Postgraduate in Any SpecializationDoctorate :Doctorate Not RequiredKey SkillsMaintenance ServicesBreakdown MaintenanceAutoCADElectrical Equipment MaintenanceCADElectrical DesignCAMElectrical Engineering

company: Businesses UTC Aerospace Systems
description: Job description  1. Detailed electronic design, including schematic capture (Cadence / Mentor Graphics). The analog circuits will include power (DC to DC), discrete I/O, preamps, amplifiers, filters, A/D conversion, and sensor signal conditioning circuits. The digital circuits will include multiplexers, FPGAs, PLDs, microcontrollers, and aircraft communications transceivers.  2. Coordinate PWB layout and circuit card(s) documentation release.   3. Documentation and fabrication of engineering breadboards, review and analyze test data, support qualification, transition products to manufacturing, and sustaining support.  4. Provide technical support for operations team  5. Thermal and performance analysis (worst case analysis, simulation or breadboard test)   6. Test support, including writing test procedure, test reports, and designing test fixtures.   7. Support formal design reviews and presentations to customer.   8. Compliance with DO-254 Complex Hardware design and substantial documentation.   The position may require occasional travel to various test facilities for set up and monitoring of qualification/integration testing or infrequent field support. Some system level support may also be necessary.   Requirements:    Qualification:   BE/B.Tech in Electrical / Electronics engineering or equivalent  Experience: 0 to 2 Years  Tools expertise on Cadence tools, MS Office Software, MS Project  Expertise with design and analysis of Analog electronics, digital electronics, power circuits, sensor interfaces, FPGAs.   Experience in making presentations and communicating with management/customers. Strong technical writing and verbal communication skills. The Marketing Manager is responsible for sales within their territories ,

Keyskills : Company Profile 

Many people view a job change as a way of promoting themselves to a better position. And in most cases ,  we at KK Consulting services would agree. However ,  you should always be sure that your new job offers you the means to satisfy your values. While there's no denying the strategic virtues of selective job changing for the purpose of career leverage ,  you want to make sure the path you take will lead you where you really want to go and want to achieve in your life.

At KK Consulting services ,  the "right" job is one in which your values are being satisfied most effectively. If career growth and advancement are your primary goals ,  and they're represented by how much you earn ,  then the job that pays the most money is the "better" job.

company: Flipkart Internet Private Limited
description: Job descriptionJob Description:Assistant Manager - Security (Location Siliguri)About FlipkartIn 2007, we started the Flipkart journey by selling books online. But now, over a decade later, our story is quite different. Today, Flipkart is India's largest online marketplace and one of India's leading technology powerhouse that is disrupting the way India shops online. What has got us here? The dynamic, passionate and talented folks we call Flipsters!Our core values define our identity and form the basis of our actions and reflect in everything that we do at Flipkart. Values enable us to shape the desired organizational culture in which each Flipster can thrive and be at their best. We believe in taking bold bets and changing the paradigm, having a sense of urgency to solve problems strategically and putting great ideas into action. We look at the world from our customer's point of view and keep customers at the heart of everything we do. We strive to do the right thing always and be committed to our customers and stakeholders. About the TeamFlipkart Security Team provides a safe and secure business environment by enhancing risk resilience, adhering to compliance standards, adopting best practices and thereby protecting Flipkart business and people in diverse environment. The team has adopted a sustainable and scalable model with the capability of mitigating emerging risks proactively and keeping in pace with the business growth.It has continuously developed & deployed Talent with synergizing strengths by leveraging cross competencies.About the Role:Primary responsibility of the Flipkart Security Assistant Manager is to ensure the implementation of security policies and procedures across Flipkart business in his Area of Responsibility (AOR) The role is cross-functional and requires deep collaboration and influencing ability with stakeholders from business, corporate functions as well as external partners.What you'll do:General Security Management Individual is responsible of a cluster of hubs which falls under his AOR. (counts varies from 25 to 30 hubs or Warehouses / FC / MH / TC / PH / LM).Manage security executives and security guards for smooth business operations. Uphold security standards as set forth by the company.Review current security practices and make recommendations to vertical heads for better implementation.Implement continuous improvement procedures as to suit business requirements.Conduct detailed advanced investigations on all issues including but not limited to Loss/theft cases only.Proactively identify and investigate potential and actual violations of safety standards and develop means to minimize risk / threats.Supervise SSE & Security agencies to protect company property and premises against internal & external threats.Assess security service providers continuously to ensure regular enhancement in security standards.Conduct security audits and inspections to reduce security risks and threat at sites.Ensure proper documentation in the department for audit purpose.Lead and supervise team of security executives & security supervisors / guards.Ensure that all security automation equipment are in working condition.Review FC security Operations, quality escalations, CS escalations, repeat OB, City logistics & BRSNR cases.Maintain and Document policies and procedures for Flipkart Warehouses and maintain security standards as per industry best practices. Logistics Security ManagementManaging Logistic security operations and improve service levels.Conducting security audits for Flipkart Mother Hubs and implementing security measures.Lead the cross functional Loss Prevention program to include policy, procedures, awareness, compliance, incident reporting and corrective actions plans.Reducing losses by controlling shrink, preventing pilferage and damages to the inventory during operations in a vast Distribution and Logistics Supply chainConducting investigations and root cause analysis for various theft, pilferage & other frauds.Training and coordinating Logistics security activities through regional security team.Physical SecurityManage the complete liaising with local law authorities and police hierarchyMotivate and improve the result orientation of the complete team membersAssess the safety norms adhered at the sites and escalate the observations to vertical headsImprove Fire Fighting standards at the site by conducting Fire Fighting TrainingAssess and visualizing the forthcoming threat and inform the management for counter measures of the sameCritically analyse the security automation set up at the sites Ascertain that the reporting and information sharing is up to date Ensure the implementation, management, operation, and maintenance, of physical security measures and security systems Define people, material and vehicle movement protocolsEnsure seamless management, control, and maintenance of physical access authorization procedures and access control protocol.Initiate process deviation and security incident reports establish escalation metrics and response structures.Maintain security incident data, with periodic trend analysis implement corrective actions plans.Create appropriate MIS reportsEmergency Response & Crisis ManagementCreation, updating, exercising and maintenance of Crisis Management organization and plans.Plan and execute various tests & exercises Follow Emergency Response and Crisis Management guidelines to handle security incidents and crises.Liaise with state authorities, police, Law Enforcement Agencies (LEAs) and emergency services on a day-to-day basis, during mock exercises and real-life incidents and crisis situations.What you'll need:University degree level or equivalent through experience and professional certification. Completion of professional security certification training e.g. PSP, TAPA or equivalent is desirable. Minimum 3 years' experience in security-related profession with logistics operations. Experience in implementation of security projects/programs in allocated AOR. Extensive and up to date knowledge of logistics security operations, standards and technology. Experience in managing or coordinating security investigations of complex nature. Knowledge of information security processes and systems. Experience in security auditing. Exemplary written and verbal communication, including ability to write reports and returns on both routine and Adhoc basis. Interpersonal collaboration skills to work with varied stakeholders across organizational levels. Disciplinary approach towards security management Ability to train and impart awareness to motivate the core security team as well as employees. Unblemished track record and high levels of personal integrity. Exemplary team motivator and genuine team player.RoleSecurity Manager,Industry TypeInternet, Ecommerce,Functional AreaDefence Forces, Security Services,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryOtherEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Any Postgraduate in Any SpecializationDoctorate :Doctorate Not RequiredKey SkillsSecurity AutomationPhysical SecurityLaw EnforcementSecurity ManagementLogistics Security ManagementSecurity Operations

company: Canonical
description: Job description  Timing Restrictions   ? No Restriction     Working Days   ? Not Mentioned        Compensation   ? Not Mentioned        Nature of Job   ? Remote    Job Summary:   The IS Security Manager protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of Canonical's information systems. Serves as expert advisor to management, peers, and employees in defining, recommending, and implementing necessary policies, controls, and procedures to cost-effectively assess and manage security-related risk, educate workforce, and participate in regulatory compliance activities, especially with regards to data privacy and security legislation. Assists with development, implementation, and maintenance of world-class information security organization, including annual and ad-hoc information security risk assessments, policy governance, compliance with regulatory requirements, information security training and awareness initiatives, third-party audits and assessments, contract and procurement guidelines, and third-party risk. Oversees and coordinates information security-related risk management.          This role can be home or office based. Periodic international travel for training and business meetings is required.         Key Responsibilities:      Shape and drive the company strategy for access controls, compliance, audit, and penetration testing that supports the company's business units and enables risk management and regulatory compliance. The challenges include identifying where and how we use data; determining what tools and technologies we should deploy; ensuring that preventive/detective/corrective controls are in place and functioning effectively; staying current with government regulations and commercial agreements governing the use of data.    Maintain security policies and work with our Legal team to respond to internal and external compliance issues.    Collaborate closely with leaders in each business unit to understand what customers they serve and in which markets those customers exist in, how data that they process and retain is categorized, what business processes make use of the data and why, and how the controls provide proper security and compliance. Be a representative for our customers, making sure that customer data is safeguarded and used ethically and responsibly.    Organize and lead Risk/Privacy/Compliance training programs across departments, in order to educate and inform employees about our practices and standards, raise the level of cooperation and help people to understand the rationale for the rules.    Manage internal and external audit and testing programs, reporting risks and areas that need correction to the senior management team and prioritizing compliance work.    Reviewing and responding to security questionnaires and contract questions from customers on Canonical s information security policies and practices.      Required skills and experience:      Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.    Ability to read, write, and review Python and/or Go code.    You are familiar with contractual compliance obligations, contractual security, privacy and completing security questionnaires and reviews.    Experience defining and implementing appropriate methodologies for penetration testing, auditing, secure coding standards, incident response playbooks, forensic analysis procedures, takedown processes/law enforcement/censorship.    You can speak intelligently about situational awareness, change management, access control, and incident response.    You have demonstrated ability to communicate complex or detailed technical topics to a non-technical business audience, clearly conveying risk assessments, actions needed, and cost implications.    You have a general understanding of privacy and compliance legislation in the UK and Europe, including the GDPR.    Experience in working with legal, audit, and compliance staff.    Experience in developing and maintaining policies, procedures, standards, and guidelines.    Experience in driving risk-based decisions supporting business owner expectations and needs.        Preferred Experience:      Strong knowledge and experience of applicable frameworks and regulatory requirements, e.g. ISO 2700x, PCI-DSS, NIST.    Strong technical or engineering background, including but not limited to software development, scripting, networking, and cloud architecture.   RoleSecurity Manager,Industry TypeIT-Software, Software Services,Functional AreaDefence Forces, Security Services,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryOtherEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsIS Security Manager

description: Job descriptionPerforms security functions such as; inspections, identification of vulnerabilities, assessment of risks. 	Make recommendations of appropriate and required security measures, techniques and methods to assure and improve the protection of personnel, activities and facilities of the organization. 	Develops and/or implements policies, procedures, standards, training and methods for identifying and protecting information, personnel, property, facilities, operations, or material from unauthorized disclosure, misuse, theft, assault, vandalism, product tampering, espionage, sabotage, or loss.  	Recommends and coordinates the acquisition, installation or replacement of equipment designed to increase efficiency of security operations at facilities.  	Receives and evaluates all security related incidents and makes recommendations to preclude recurrence. 	Independently plans and conducts sensitive and complex security assessments and briefs senior management on the status of these investigations. 	Leads large-scale security inspections and risk assessments. 	Evaluates the latest products and techniques in communications and other technical equipment. 	Uses leadership ability to mentor lesser experienced team members.  	Ensure smooth traffic flow in the Company premises. 	Develop an emergency preparedness plan and facilitate and support people in times of emergencies. 	Prevent encroachment on Companys estate including residential areas and mangroves 	Environment scanning, intelligence collection, collation and maintaining vigil on activities of persons and organizations. 	Liaison with Govt officials, Statutory bodies including Police etc. at local level and at locations where the Company has its establishments. 	Coordinate safety and security issues with neighboring complexes.  	Advice senior management on confidential or sensitive matters and act as a conduit between the management and the police at all levels in order to expedite solutions to difficult situations. 	Receive and deal with any information that has a security dimension and deal with this in a confidential manner. 	Proactive in relation to identifying and solving problems so that consistent and appropriate services are available and delivered. 	Develop policies and procedures and ensure that they are communicated to and interpreted appropriately by staffing order minimum risk of crime. 	Responsible for ensuring that all legislative requirements in the area of responsibility are adhered to. 	Oversee occupational safety within Commercial and residential complexes.RoleChief Security Officer,Industry TypeFacility Management,Functional AreaDefence Forces, Security Services,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryOtherEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any Specialization, Graduation Not RequiredPG :MBA/PGDM in Any Specialization, Hospitality ManagementDoctorate :Doctorate Not RequiredKey Skillssecurity operationsChief Security OfficerLoss PreventionSurveillanceResidentialchief security representativeInvestigationSecurityFacility Management

description: Job description    Our Team         The current team consists of two Security Managers. The new Associate manager being hired will be assisting the Global Security Manager in managing the security functioning at GTS IDC.     Your Opportunity       You will be part of Global Security team. The Global Security team is a part of Global Security, Aviation (GSA) team of Walmart. GSA is Walmart division that is responsible for all security for Walmart. As part of this team, you are the key security person to assist the Security Manager at WMGTS IDC to manage & implement all security programs in WMGTS. .           Your Responsibility:       Being located in the Building Complex of BLDG 10 & 11 at SEZ, You will be responsible for the following:    Implement Risk mitigation measures & Management of Risk at Building 10 & 11.    Design security measure to safeguard associates, prevent un - authorized access to Walmart equipment Facilities, materials against sabotage, theft - Loss prevention.    Organize & Supervise all the Physical Security activities that support the Brand Protection GTS IDC Bengaluru at Building 10 & 11location    Own the Access control, VMS & CCTv plan at GTS Building 10 & 11    Access Control: Should have a good understanding of all the current systems, functioning, operations and maintenance. You will be managing these systems as part of your duties    CCTV: Should have a good understanding of all current systems, functioning, operations and maintenance. You will be managing these systems as part of your duties    About work place violence, abide by the Statutory & regulatory requirement of the law Enforcement and intelligence agencies of the Govt of Karnataka    Coordinate Security processes with the industrial security teams at the Prestige Business Tech park    BCP Plan & Program coordinator for GTS IDC Bengaluru at Building 10 & 11, Business pillars    Assist in disaster management at Building 10 & 11, as a member of the IDC Bengaluru Crisis Management Team at Building 10 & 11.    Plan & Train the Associates in Fire Safety and Fire Evacuation drill. Conduct Fire Safety training at the floors as per the approved plan for the IDC Bengaluru    Review and timely evaluation of security processes for up - dates to the Sr Manager, GSIS at Bengaluru    Conduct Security Audits: Should have a good knowledge of how to conduct security audit for any new office or premises so as to assist the Global Security Manager while conducting such audits.    Fire Fighting: Should be well versed with the local laws on firefighting, how to conduct the fire drills, organize and train the various parties, understand of MERT & Fire teams. The building firefighting system and their tracking. Able to work out the requirement of firefighting equipment s as per local law for the building and floors. As part of your duty you will be managing this by yourself    Policies: Will assist the Security Manger to update and ensure that all security policies are upto date and that all security audits are done    Managing the 3rd Party Security Force in GTS: Your responsibilities are as follows:    # Drawn out the contract with the 3rd Party Security Firm based on a comprehensive analysis done by you of the other security firms and evaluation of the best and cost effective option available for GTS.    # Will manage the 3rd Party Security guard force - deployment, training, administration and manage the attendance of the force while deployed in GTS.    # Provide the annual budget estimates for the 3rd Party guard to include all GTS events and functions.    # Resolve all issues with 3rd Party Security Vendor    # Investigate any incident related to 3rd Party Security Vendor    Facility Safety: have a good knowledge on Facility Safety    Executive Protection: individual with working knowledge of EP will be preferred    Event Management - be able to provide inputs and manage events organized by GTS    AMC - Be aware of the AMC for all security systems    Risk analysis - provide risk analysis for events and security situation to enable crisis management team to take timely decision.    On instructions from the Security Manager IDC, Liaise with Police, Intelligence & Firefighting Agencies - build and maintain a high level of liaison with the local agencies and OSAC    On instructions from the security manager be prepared to under - take additional responsibilities of security management at IDC           Your Knowledge     Should have good understanding of a global security issues.    Must demonstrate strong knowledge of theatre or country - based risk histories, including security, political and law enforcement, Business and compliance issues that directly effect or impact the company.    Expert knowledge of security and risk assessment methodology and deploying solutions, capable of changing them to meet emerging needs.      Proven experience in handling and implementing crisis management, emergency, preparedness and response programs    Wide range of leadership experience and skills in controlling crisis events.    Has fairly Strong Analytical skill and pro - active capability to resolve issues on a timely manner    Fairly Strong working knowledge of security systems and their inherent capabilities and limitations.    Fair amount of Experience in planning and implementation of BCP, Pandemic plans.    Fair amount of working knowledge of computer systems and applications designed to support Physical Security efforts.    Has proven ability to work with external agencies, such as police and government organizations, in the areas of intelligence gathering, risk assessment and partnership - building that would or could materially, positively effect the company.    Has knowledge in budgeting with regard to planning and security expenditures. Ability to develop, manage and control budgets and expenses.    Strong written and verbal communication    Skills in cross cultural corporate environment    Travel if required.      Previous work experience in Armed Forces, Police and Intelligence agencies at middle management officer level is highly desirable and sought for.           Your Qualifications       Experience of Min 5 - 8 Years in a mid - level security position    Preferably hold a bachelor s Degree.    You should have experience in managing Security vendors to execute the routine security operations in an IT company in a multi - tenanted building.    You should have strong interpersonal skills and should be able to communicate at all levels within the Company.    You should have proficiency in the use of MS word, Excel, Power Point etc     Organizational Relationship     Who is the Supervisor - Security Manager GTS IDC    Who is the Functional Supervisor - Security Manager GTS IDC    How many Direct reports - Specialists    Current Area of Responsibility - Associate Manager GTS IDC At Building 10 & 11    Number of Subordinates - 1 - 6 of different IDC locations     Our Ideal Candidate       Our ideal candidate is an energetic, self - motivated individual focused on solving Physical & Corporate Security problems. The person is a responsive team player who can proactively contribute at an individual level. The person is someone of high integrity & personal discipline who should be adaptable to the Walmart GTS environment. description: Job description  job responsibility :    MAJOR KEY RESULT AREAS: 1. Carry out risk assessment to identify potential, perceived and present risk to the business and take proactive and practical control measures to reduce, minimize and eliminate identified risk. 2. Interact regularly with management, operations and other functions on matters concerning security, Loss Prevention, associated matters to explain and improve security awareness. 3. Ensuring the security procedures are integrated and aligned to operational requirements each should complement one another and help in effective process flow to reduce risk, losses and assists in enhance business performance. 4. Constant review of security procedures and parameters by carrying out security audit, visits, security assessment and review to provide uninterrupted security support to PPC, HUB & DCs. 5. Ensuring that the operations staff are updated on the security procedures and follow it at all times. 6. Keep constant vigil to foresee emerging security threats and incorporate relevant technology such as CCTV, alarm systems and other physical security measures and exploit its full potential for proactive security cover and investigations. Also be responsible to install, manage and maintenance such devices with the help of IT, vendor and other support elements. 7. Identify, investigate and resolve cases of theft, pilferage, loss to the company with an aim to reduce and recover the loss and apprehend the culprit 8. Assist operation team/ management / custodian of goods/ process owner or others in lodging police complaint/ FIR and as demanded by the situation to pursue and safe guard companys legitimate business interest. 9. Maintain liaison with Police and Government authorities to ensure the companies objectives are met in case of eventualities. 10. Manage outsourced security agency and ensure that security guards are deployed to meet our security requirement. Ensuring that the guards are well aware of their responsibility and comply with the laid down procedures. company: Leading Client
description: Job descriptionWe are hiring for Security Manager - MALE position (Ex- Servicemen - Army / Navy / Air Force )) behalf of our reputed Client @ Bangalore location. The candidate should be Good physic not more-than 45+ years with communication fluency in     English & Hindi + Local Language along with Proficiency in Computer operations (MS word & Excel) . Below given as the detailed roles and responsibility;    Security    Manager - Ex servicemen (ARMY / NAVY/ AIR FORCE )Security operates in General shift and reports directly to the Unit Head and a dotted line reporting to the Corporate Security Head.The    Security     Manager will be the link between the Security agency deployed at the Unit and the Unit management. Though the overall responsibility of Unit Security operations lies with Security agency, it will be operationally driven by     Security ManagerResponsible for the effective management of the integrated Physical Security Guard force consisting of:-Guarding staff,Security Supervisor/ Security Officer , Access control team,Front office Executives &Security Control Centre teamThe following domains under physical security operations will be under the charter of     Security    Manager - who will oversee the function and provide constant support and supervision.Security Force ManagementMaintaining and reviewing Post & Site instructions for all the security posts in the campus.Conducting briefing for the staff in shift covering all the aspects as intimated by the Unit Head.Monitoring the deployment of guards in respective shifts as per the roster.Ensuring that there is no shortage of security staff by working closely with Security service provider.Identifying the resources with potential and recommending the Security agency for their progression and rewards as appropriate.Managing the leave and relief of security staff of the location.Monitoring the effectiveness of security staff at the duty posts.Access Control systemEnsure the implementation of access control system as per the policy for enabling and disabling.Ensure the sharing of the following on time:Weekly access review reminder/Monthly access review/Logs (in case of requirement on approval)Ensure the maintaining of approval mails for access for audit trails.Ensuring sufficient stock of access cards, ID Badge and tags available at location.InvestigationReporting cases and incidents to the Unit Head/Passing on the lessons learnt to the entire team/Visitor ManagementEnsuring that the FOE( Front office Executive) and team is aware of the process, policy and updates on the same from time to time.Reviewing the process and guest experiences which can be an input for USL - Security leads to refine the process.Checking the documents maintained at front office for proper upkeep.Monitoring the consumption of stationary and placing the indent for requirements every quarter.Destruction of old documents as per the policy and directions of Corporate Security Head.Upkeep of Security equipment's:Monitoring the following equipment's for their serviceability through service providers/ stakeholders as applicable:Perimeter intrusion detection system alarm,,Access control system,CCTV,PA system,XBIS, EVD, HHMD, DFMD, Radio sets, and all assets related to the function,Emergency Management.Participating and coordinating with EHS team security/ safety drills,Badging,Approving the ID Badge applications for the duration of contract validity after ensuring the submission of relevant documents by the applicant.Ensuring the security induction for all applicants before issuing the ID Badge.Material movementEnsure compliance of defined material movement process through system operator and stake holdersCreating/ coordinating ID for contractors and employees of support function to enable online gate pass approval.Ensuring maintenance of records as per the policy and follow up for pending materials.Vendor ManagementEnsuring the working of dedicated entry point (as appropriate) for dealing with the movements of vendors/service providers.Sharing the details of authorized vendors/ service providers with access to the Vendor movement gate.Ensuring the implementation of process of security checks for vendors and service provider.Parking ManagementEnsure that the parking inside the campus is as per Policy and no violation takes place.Escalating the violation cases to Unit Head.Ensuring the monitoring of status of parking space availability and displaying the same for information of employees.Coordinating with the Peer functions to ensure smooth functioning of Security operations and equipments.AuditsPreparing and supporting the Unit Head and the Corporate Security Head on audits and timely closure of observations if any for:Internal Audit/Third Party Audit/GAR / IA Audits /360* Security Risk AssessmentOther responsibilitiesIdentify vulnerabilities and threats to Key Assets and share the risks foreseen to the Unit Head and the Corporate Security Head.Initiation of incident report and timely reports & Returns.To undertake other duties as can reasonably be expected which are commensurate with the role.Building informers and intelligence network among employees and service providers to enable early warning mechanisms.Approving the bills on MOS( manpower outsourcing) and other maintenance bills for correctness before producing the same for USL - security lead's approval.Regular round to be taken of the locations during each shifts and ensure documentation of rounds by guarding staff.Academic Qualification -* any graduate form a recognized university.* security related courses will be an added advantage.Experience -* 2 -5 years relative experience in security domain.* Experience in handling manufacturing units will be an added advantage.Computer skills -* Knowledge of MS Word, MS Excel, etc.* Internet skillsCommunication -* Fluency in English and Hindi - verbal and writing* any other local language will be an added advantageIf you are interested please share your updated resume to: antony.vl@manpower.co.inRequired Candidate profileThe candidate must be Good Physic Ex- Servicemen - Army / Navy / Air Force (Male Candidate )and age should be not more-than 45+ years with company: Flipkart Internet Private Limited
description: Job descriptionAbout the TeamFlipkart Security Team provides a safe and secure business environment by enhancing risk resilience, adhering to compliance standards, adopting best practices and thereby protecting Flipkart business and people in diverse environment. The team has adopted a sustainable and scalable model with the capability of mitigating emerging risks proactively and keeping in pace with the business growth. It has continuously developed & deployed Talent with synergizing strengths by leveraging cross competencies.About the rolePrimary responsibility of the Security Cluster Manager is to ensure the implementation of security policies and procedures across Flipkart business in his Area of Responsibility (AOR) The role is cross-functional and requires deep collaboration and influencing ability with stakeholders from business, corporate functions as well as external partners.What you'll do:1. General Security Managementa) Single point of contact for all Corporate Security matters in his AOR.b) Primarily responsible to manage a process driven, uniform and consistent security programc) Draft, get approved and implement Security SOPs across business.d) Undertake Employee awareness drives to achieve employees' compliance with security procedurese) Ensure development and implementation of security plan based on Security SOPsf) Conduct periodic risk assessments, audits and self-assessments for Flipkart businessg) Ensure communication and liaison between regional Management and Security function.h) Rendering security support to stakeholders, internal and external customers as needed.Drive cross functional collaboration, to ensure seamless deployment of security processes.i) Drive and run logistics security program with the objective of proactive reduction in shrinkagej) Drive standardization and benchmarking to ensure continual process improvementk) Recruit, induct, groom, motivate and drive a team of diverse background to create centers of excellence. Additionally, Train, coach and manage Security Regional teams.l) Develop and maintain external partnerships, i.e. law enforcement, emergency services, etc.m) Security vendor governancen) Budget management2. Logistics Security Managementa) Managing Logistic security operations and improving service levels.b) Conducting risk assessments & security audits for Flipkart Logistic Centers and implementing risk mitigation measures.c) Lead the cross functional Loss Prevention program to include policy, procedures, awareness, compliance, incident reporting and corrective actions plans.d) Reducing losses by controlling shrink, preventing pilferage and damages to the inventory during operations in a vast Distribution and Logistics Supply chaine) Conducting investigations and root cause analysis for various theft, pilferage & other fraudsf) Training and coordinating Logistics security activities through the regional security team.g) Responsible for maintaining working relationships and liaison with law enforcement and related agencies.h) Lodging of complaints (FIRS) with Police and following up until case closure, providing Litigation support for incidents as and when required, in assistance from the Legal team.3. Physical Securitya) Ensure the implementation, management, operation, and maintenance, of physical security measures and security systems - Perimeter protection, Access Control System, CCTV system, Intrusion Detection System and Security Lighting.b) Define people, material and vehicle movement protocolsc) Ensure seamless management, control, and maintenance of physical access authorization procedures and access control protocol.d) Initiate process deviation and security incident reports, establish escalation metrics and response structures.e) Maintain security incident data, with periodic trend analysis implement corrective actions plansf) Create appropriate MIS reports4. Security projects & servicesa) Undertake, design & implement security projects in given timelines and budgetsb) Manage and monitor cost, performance and quality of projects related to infrastructure & process enhancement.c) Ensure consistent security services - security guarding, alarm monitoring & response, visitor management, access control, material movement and security documentation.d) Ensure security team contribution in cross functional projects, to support business goals5. Emergency Response & Crisis Managementa) Creation, updating, exercising and maintenance of Crisis Management organization and plans.b) Plan and execute various tests & exercisesc) Follow Emergency Response and Crisis Management guidelines to handle security incidents and crises.d) Liaise with state authorities, police, Law Enforcement Agencies (LEAs) and emergency services on a day-to-day basis, during mock exercises and real-life incidents and crisis situations.Required Candidate profileWhat you'll need:* University degree or equivalent.* Completion of professional security certification e.g. CPP, PSP, TAPA or equivalent is desirable.* Minimum 5 years' experience in military, law enforcement or security-related profession with threeyears of corporate experience in logistics operations* Experience in implementation of security projects/programs with a large-scale budget.* Extensive and up to date knowledge of logistics security operations, standards and technology.* Experience in managing or coordinating security investigations of complex nature.* Knowledge of information security processes and systems.* Experience in security auditing.Open Positions :1Skills Required :Supply chain or logistics backgroundEducation/Qualification :GraduateDesirable Skills :Major or Captain from Army or Navy backgroundYears Of Exp :10 to 15 Years RoleSecurity Manager,Industry TypeInternet, Ecommerce,Functional AreaDefence Forces, Security Services,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryOtherEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Any Postgraduate in Any SpecializationDoctorate :Doctorate Not RequiredKey SkillsPhysical SecurityAccess Control Systemlogistics security operationsLaw EnforcementCorporate SecuritySecurity OperationsGeneral Security ManagementSecurity SystemsSecurity Services

company:
SISA is a payment security specialist firm having presence in 30 countries. Started in 2003,  SISA provides payment security assurance services,  training and products to over 1, 000 customers across the globe. We are a QSA-C for the PCI SSC since 2007 and over the years we have built our expertise in Payments security space. We are an authorized assessor for various Payments standards and are listed as a PCI QSA,  PCI ASV,  PA-QSA,  P2PE-QSA,  PCI PFI and VISA Approved PCI PIN Security Assessor. 

SISA is a pioneer in Synergistic Security which combines Consulting,  Training and Products in our endeavor to create a secure payments infrastructure for our customers. Synergistic security model helps organizations to enhance their security posture at an optimum cost. Our customer base is spread across various domains including banks,  ITES,  insurance,  e-commerce,  payment service providers,  airlines,  telecommunications and retail industries.  

Payments Security Specialists

description: Job descriptionDear Candidate,Nelito is seeking a highly  motivated professional to join its Cyber Security Audit Team. The successful  candidate will work in a technically diverse and dynamic environment with a  team of Technology Audit Security professionals responsible for auditing all  aspects of the customer's cyber security activities. The successful candidate  will be involved in multiple aspects of leading audits within the cyber  security audit program. Candidates should have experience in conducting  security research, reverse engineering, and understand a variety of web,  application, and Internet protocols. Candidates should be able to  identify potential threats against those systems and assess the customer's risk  mitigation effectiveness in minimizing those threats.  The duties and  responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:   Perform external audits to  validate the effectiveness of cyber security controls at the customer end  Conduct application,  network, and operating system security assessments.  Assess security monitoring  of clients, servers, applications, and network infrastructure activities.  Conduct log analysis to  identify suspicious or malicious activity and anomalous behavior.  Support the analysis,  design, functional review and interpretation of requirements of security  related hardware and software of the clients.  Support the auditing of  security policy and procedure which safeguard infrastructure, systems, files  and data of the clients.  Assess Vulnerability  Management programs and provide the reports to clients.  Support Threat Intelligence  activities.  Understand Data Protection  risks and strategies.  Perform Network Penetration  testing and cybersecurity related security assessments.  Effective Stakeholder  Management.  Knowledge of key  regulations and industry standards such as ISO 27001&2, NIST SP800-53, and  the NIST Cybersecurity Framework.  Experience in using VAPT  tools such as Nessus, Metasploit etc.  Candidate must be ready to relocate  or travel anywhere in India.  Bachelor's       degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience       required. Degree in technology field preferred.  CISA,       CISSP, CISM, CEH, or related certifications       preferred.  3-6       years of relevant experience. Prior experience in Audit       or Cybersecurity practices preferred.  Additional       core skill requirements include critical thinking, problem solving, and effective       communication skills (both written and verbal). Adequate       knowledge of Operating Systems (Windows, UNIX, Mainframe etc) and       Databases (SQL, Oracle etc)  Interested Candidates kindly send your resume on bhanvi.serene@nelito.com with below detailsCurrent ctcexpected ctcNPRoleSystem Security,Industry TypeIT-Software, Software Services,Functional AreaIT Software - Client/Server Programming,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryAdmin/Maintenance/Security/DatawarehousingEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Post Graduation Not Required, Any Postgraduate in Any SpecializationDoctorate :Doctorate Not Required, Any Doctorate in Any SpecializationKey SkillsCyber SecurityNetworkingMetasploitVaptISO 27001Threat IntelligenceNistNessusVulnerability ManagementNetwork Penetration Testing

description: Job description  Job Description and Responsibilities : Interactive Brokers Software Service India ("IBSSI") is looking for senior software engineers with Java concentration with experience working in Unix/Linux environments to help make our customer-facing trading applications and back-end systems even better.  If you are proficient in developing front-end systems or corresponding back-end services for them, have solid programming experience, love the challenge of developing complex real-time solutions, and enjoy working in a dynamic environment with a strong team, then Interactive Brokers may be just the place for you. This job is heavily oriented toward designing, building and optimizing trading and back-office applications.  As an JSE, youll join a team of highly talented and motivated engineers who are passionate about their work. description: Job descriptionMedline Industries, Inc. Information Services department is seeking a Sr. Manager with five (5) or more years of experience managing Ecommerce applications. This individual must be a highly motivated leader, visionary and techno-savvy business partner.  He/She should be able to direct independently managed specialized teams in realizing Ecommerce vision, technology excellence, product delivery and operations, while working effectively within a global environment. In addition to exceptional leadership and analytical skills, the individual must have a roll-up your sleeves attitude.   The challenging responsibilities of the position include:      Accountable for providing overall direction and integration for several technology Product and Project delivery services.  Understands the business strategy in supported areas and partners with stakeholders to develop a common vision and IT strategy.  Actively participates in long-range strategy planning and manages policy development to address complex business issues, provides leadership to technical and cross-functional teams.  Communicates and guides within his teams to deliver on IT strategy and works with other leaders to ensure appropriate integration of people, process and technology across the enterprise. Provide oversight and direction in his/her areas of responsibility.  Must possess an in-depth understanding of Ecommerce platforms and solutions. Needs to have a broad industry view, exposure to latest trends on automation, experience transforming departments and implementing various software development methodologies.  Responsible for capability assessment, organizing new areas of responsibility, establishment of new technology services, fostering innovation and process excellence within the individuals organization.  Responsible for organizational development and overall personnel management on reporting teams - recruiting, hiring, performance coaching, reviews, corrective action, career development and talent/succession planning . Provide oversight in compensation of reporting teams.  Demonstrates ability to lead team members by influence, not relying on authority for leadership.  Demonstrates genuine leadership characteristics.  Maintain a professional demeanor at all times.  Consistently interact professionally and work productively with all levels of Medline employees.  Follow Medlines Code of Ethics and other corporate policies.      Specific Areas of Focus & delivery:     Sales Force Automation (leading teams through next generation of Sales force enablement technologies and analytics)  Managed Care Systems (transforming Patient direct processes and digital experience)  People Management (Through coaching and mentoring, effectively lead and develop multiple teams ensuring they are engaged and leveraged appropriately)   In return, Medline offers a business casual, entrepreneurial work environment with strong growth potential; a competitive compensation package; along with a complete benefits package and much more!    Requirements include:      Should be able to define vision to achieve business objectives and put in place focused strategic initiatives.  A strong leader with ability to direct and manage team for delivery excellence and business agility.  Intensive experience in technology delivery and driving transformational change with minimum 14+ years of implementation experience over large and diverse system landscapes.  Deep experience implementing and managing Ecommerce applications including ATG/Oracle Commerce.  3+ years of in-depth exposure to Agile practices, DevOps and Product delivery.  Strong knowledge about local market and vendors, effectively leveraging partners for delivering initiatives successfully.  Must be highly motivated people manager with previous experience of nurturing multiple global teams and mentoring managers to become independent performers.  4 year degree (or higher) in Computer Science or a related field  Excellent communication, networking and influencing skills  Similar role in Captives preferred     Medline is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. We are committed to cultural diversity in the workforce. description: Job descriptionOne of our leading international VC's to hire for the profile of CTO   (Chief Technology Officer) for one of their largest eCommerce companies.   You will play a critical role in scaling the team and technology, in   building a high-performance & high-quality culture and helping the   business to grow with fast paced product innovation.   Your responsibilities:   - Responsible to build and manage the tech team for one of the   largest eCommerce companies with more than 1500 employees in 14   countries.   - Find and select talented people to scale up a great team, which is located in Paris and Porto   - Lead the development of multiple high-traffic eCommerce sites   - Deep knowledge you are able to solve complex problems and support your team hands on   - In charge of product delivery, quality, architecture and operations   - Manage projects, timelines and releases  Required Candidate profile Desired Skills and Experience:   - Hands on coder at heart. Compensation: Very competitive and the best in the industry.
